node.title: Paul Gosar Responds to Censure Over AOC Meme With Comparison to Charlie Hebdo Massacre
node.alt: Representative Paul Gosar responded to being censured by the House of Representatives after the Republican posted a violent cartoon on social media. Here, Gosar can be seen during a news conference.
node.description: The Arizona Republican called the fact that people would consider the meme violent "lunacy" and that "all of Hollywood" must be shut down.
node.content:
["Representative Paul Gosar, an Arizona Republican, compared his congressional censure Wednesday to events that led to 2015's Charlie Hebdo massacre.", "Gosar was censured by the House of Representatives for posting a photoshopped anime video on social media that showed him attacking President Joe Biden and killing Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, a New York Democrat.", "", "
Representative Paul Gosar responded to being censured by the House of Representatives after the Republican posted a violent cartoon on social media. Here, Gosar can be seen during a news conference.
", "In a statement, Gosar mocked the House's decision to censure him, saying that if his cartoon incited violence, then \"Cartoon Network, Disney and all of Hollywood\" must also be shut down.", "Gosar went on to say that the suppression of cartoons is what led to the Charlie Hebdo massacre. Occurring in Paris, France, at the Charlie Hebdo newspaper headquarters in 2015, the massacre led to the deaths of 12 people while injuring 11 others.", "This is a breaking story and will be updated with additional information. "]
